CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 3 showed the oxidation of cyclic voltammograms of the polymer films on graphite disk electrode in tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate ( Bu 4 NPF 6 ) solution ( 0.1 M in acetonitrile ) at a scan rate of 50 mV s^-1 .

Let's think step by step.

1. tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate (Bu4NPF6)
2. acetonitrile
3. polymer films
4. graphite disk electrode
5. Tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate (Bu4NPF6) solution

The first entity identified is "tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate (Bu4NPF6)". It is a specific type of ionic liquid, which is the material used as the electrolyte in the experiment.

The second entity identified is "acetonitrile". It is the solvent used to dissolve the electrolyte (Bu4NPF6) in the experiment.

The third entity identified is "polymer films". The paragraph describes the oxidation of polymer films on a graphite disk electrode. The type of polymer is not specified in the paragraph.

The fourth entity identified is "graphite disk electrode". It is the material used as the working electrode in the experiment.

The fifth entity identified is "Tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate (Bu4NPF6) solution". It is the electrolyte solution used in the experiment.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate (Bu4NPF6)
2. acetonitrile
3. polymer films

The irrelevant entities in the paragraph are "Figure 3", "showed", "the oxidation of", "cyclic voltammograms", "on graphite disk electrode", "in tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate (Bu4NPF6) solution", "( 0.1 M in acetonitrile )", "at a scan rate of 50 mV s^-1". These entities do not directly refer to the material names mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate (Bu4NPF6) |
| acetonitrile |
| polymer films |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 3 showed the oxidation of cyclic voltammograms of the polymer films on graphite disk electrode in tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate ( Bu 4 NPF 6 ) solution ( 0.1 M in acetonitrile ) at a scan rate of 50 mV s^-1 .

Let's think step by step.

1. Figure 3: This is a reference to a specific figure in the text. It is not a property value, but rather a label for a visual representation.
2. The oxidation of cyclic voltammograms: This is a process or event described in the text. It is not a property value.
3. Polymer films: This is a type of material or substance mentioned in the text. It is not a property value.
4. On graphite disk electrode: This is a location or position mentioned in the text. It is not a property value.
5. In tetrabutyl ammonium hexafluorophosphate (Bu4NPF6) solution: This is a solution or medium mentioned in the text. The specific composition of the solution (0.1 M in acetonitrile) could be considered property values, but "Bu4NPF6 solution" as a whole is not.
6. At a scan rate of 50 mV s^-1 : This is a condition or parameter mentioned in the text. The value "50 mV s^-1" is a property value, representing the scan rate.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.
1. The scan rate: This is a property value, representing the rate of the scan in cyclic voltammetry experiments, specifically mentioned as 50 mV s^-1.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| The scan rate: 50 mV s^-1 |
